meanings.definition: Characterized by or produced with extravagance and profusion
meanings.sent1: The princess wore a lavish gown to the ball.
meanings.sent2: The wealthy businessman lived in a lavish mansion.
meanings.sent3: The lavish birthday party had a chocolate fountain.
meanings.sent4: Her lavish imagination painted colorful dreams.
meanings.sent5: The lavish sunset painted the sky in hues of gold and pink.

meanings.definition: To bestow or expend with profusion
meanings.sent1: She would lavish gifts on her grandchildren.
meanings.sent2: The chef would lavish attention on every dish he prepared.
meanings.sent3: He decided to lavish compliments on his boss to get a promotion.
meanings.sent4: The sun would lavish warmth on the earth each morning.
meanings.sent5: The artist would lavish care on every stroke of the brush.

meanings.definition: To expend or give in great amounts or without limit
meanings.sent1: The company would lavish resources on the new project.
meanings.sent2: The parents would lavish love on their children.
meanings.sent3: The magician would lavish tricks on the audience, leaving them amazed.
meanings.sent4: The garden would lavish blooms in the spring.
meanings.sent5: The ocean would lavish waves upon the shore.
